clues.text: Hailing from West Branch, Iowa, he was the first president born west of the Mississippi
He wrote the letters collected in the book "Dear Bess"
In the 1870s she banned not only alcohol from the White House but smoking as well
In 1848 this former president from New York ran for office again, this time on the Free-Soil ticket
This early president's British-born wife Louisa was the only First Lady born abroad
The gold standard of fake rock bands is this group whose "hits" include "Big Bottom" & "Sex Farm"
Not The Who but The Why played the Polk High School Reunion on this sitcom that featured Al & Peg Bundy
Alice Bowie was the punkish band put together by Cheech & Chong in this dopey 1978 epic
The vivacious Ann-Margrock rocked the house on this TV series back in 1963
Originally named Deathtongue, Billy & The Boingers first cracked out the heavy metal in this comic strip

rounds.comments: (Alex: I'll give you a lot of letters.)

clues.text:
"T.R.B.O.C."
by Stephen Crane

"D.O.A.S."
by Arthur Miller

"H.O.D."
by Joseph Conrad

"T.O.A."
by William Shakespeare

"T.P.O.T.W.W."
by John Millington Synge
Connected to the nose on each side are hollow cavities known as these from the Latin for "curves"
Between the back of the tongue & the trachea, it contains the vocal cords & is also called the voice box
Also known as the eardrum, this tightly stretched membrane is about 10 mm in diameter
The inner ear has many interconnected structures & is somtimes called this; no minotaurs there, however
It connects your middle ear to the back of the throat & it opens when you yawn, swallow or blow your nose
This ringed planet is the farthest one from earth that can be seen with the naked eye
It's actually too small to influence other planets' orbits, the theory that led to its discovery
With thick clouds reflecting lots of light, this planet was once known as Lucifer & Phosphorus
Astrologers say that when this "Planet of Communication" goes retrograde, stuff on Earth falls apart
This planet's day is almost exactly the same as ours--24 hours, 37 minutes

No money, no goods:
C.O.D.

A first sale of stock on the open market:
IPO

Pertaining to a fictitious name:
DBA

Furnisher of financial data on Wall St.:
S&P

A salary increase in response to inflation:
COLA

rounds.category: WHAT COULD SHE BE DOING IN THERE?

clues.text: Giving herself a wavy look with a home one of these--if it doesn't work, she may not come out for days
Soothing her tired eyes with slices of this veggie that's popular in British tea sandwiches
Improving her pedicure with this object made using ground corundum
Using a pumice stone to do this to her skin, from the Latin for "to strip leaves"
Using this Jergens brand's strips to clean out her pores -- I wouldn't go in right now
After an all-night negotiation led to a settlement, Tom Glavine revealed, "There is no strike" in this sport
After that pretzel incident, she said, "You will be glad to know the president is practicing safe snacks"
A former senator from Tennessee, he quipped in 2002, "I am concerned about the economy. I was the first one laid off"
Prodded about possible insider trading, she remarked on national TV, "I want to focus on my salads"
Regarding Mick Jagger's knighthood, he scoffed, "It's a paltry honor... hold out for the Lordship, mate"
Frank Zappa's daughter thinks "Good Times" comic Jimmie is "Dy-no-mite!" & becomes this, like Buzz Aldrin
Sen. Rodham Clinton conquers Sir Edmund who conquered Everest & becomes...
If actress Lange of "Peyton Place" turned on the "Heartlight" of singer Neil, she'd have this jewel of a name
Ms. Khan, once the lead singer of Rufus, feels for Senator Trent & gets this sweet name
Ms. Frontiere, owner of the Rams, marries Lucrezia's brother Cesare & gets this rhyming name
Since 1819 Monaco's judicial system has been based on this neighbor's code
The Spanish ports of Ceuta & Melilla actually lie on the Mediterranean coast of this North African nation
The Sanskrit words at the bottom of this country's national emblem mean "truth alone triumphs"
About 90% of the people of this country which borders Burundi on the north are Hutu, about 9% Tutsi
The coat of arms of the Netherlands is a combination of those of the Dutch republic & this royal house
The highest-level church meetings take place in this city founded by Mormons on July 24, 1847
Mormons consider themselves this, like about 2 billion others; Southern Baptists don't agree
The cornerstone for the first of these was laid on July 23, 1833 in Kirtland, Ohio
Though challenged by Sidney Rigdon, he became leader of the church in 1844
This heavenly being, son of the prophet Mormon, appeared to Joseph Smith in 1823
The Greeks were using rods as money until they appropriated the idea of these from the Lydians
Xanthippe's husband, he had his own "method" of asking questions
Hesiod said this group of nine goddesses met him on Mt. Helicon & breathed the gift of song into him
These federations included Achaean, Delian & Amphictyonic--no National or American
A Hoplite was a soldier named for his hoplon, one of these that was round, heavy & made of wood & bronze

rounds.text: From the same state, they're the 2 presidents whose occupations are listed by World Book as "planter"
